    • Method Detail

      • drawRect

        public void drawRect(double x,
                     double y,
                     double width,
                     double height)
        This is the method which draws rectangles, takes 4 doubles as input.
        Parameters:
        x, - first x coordinate of the rectangle (where you start dragging)
        y, - first y coordinate of the rectangle (where you start dragging)
        width, - width of the rectangle you want to draw
        height, - height of the rectangle you want to draw

      • drawe

        public void drawe(double x,
                  double y,
                  double width,
                  double height)
        This is the method which draws ellipses, takes 4 doubles as input.
        Parameters:
        x, - first x coordinate of the ellipse (where you start dragging)
        y, - first y coordinate of the ellipse (where you start dragging)
        width, - width of the ellipse you want to draw
        height, - height of the ellipse you want to draw

      • drawRound

        public void drawRound(double x,
                      double y,
                      double width,
                      double height)
        This is the method which draws rounded rectangles, takes 4 doubles as input.
        Parameters:
        x, - first x coordinate of the rounded rectangle (where you start dragging)
        y, - first y coordinate of the rounded rectangle (where you start dragging)
        width, - width of the rectangle you want to draw
        height, - height of the rectangle you want to draw

      • addUndo

        public void addUndo(java.util.Stack<javafx.scene.image.Image> UndoHistory,
                    PaintCanvas canvas)
        This helps us with undo/redo.
        Parameters:
        UndoHistory, - the stack in which it holds the stuff you did
        canvas, - the canvas from which you are undoing

      • initDraw

        public void initDraw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                     javafx.scene.control.Slider s,
                     javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker c)
        This is the method called which assists in the creation of the pencil tool/line drawer.
        Parameters:
        gc, - graphics context very necessary, through this we set the colors and line width
        s, - slider that sets our line width
        c, - color picker that sets the color for both stroke and fill

      • initRect

        public void initRect(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                     javafx.scene.control.Slider s,
                     javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker c,
                     javafx.scene.control.ColorPicker c2)
        This is the method called which assists in the creation of the shapes tools.
        Parameters:
        gc, - graphics context very necessary, through this we set the colors and line width
        s, - slider that sets the width of the stroke
        c, - color picker that sets the color for stroke
        c2, - color picker that sets the color for the fill

      • drawText

        public void drawText(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc,
                     double x,
                     double y)
        This is what helps us use the text tool.
        Parameters:
        gc, - graphics context very necessary, through this we draw the text
        x, - x coordinate of where you click
        y, - y coordinate of where you click

        public void logAction(java.lang.String action)
        This is the method which logs the actions being done
        Parameters:
        action, - this is the string that describes what is being used/clicked.
